info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 14 at 4:24PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Robeson and north central Dillon Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 424 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Rowland, or 8 miles north of Dillon, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Dillon, Red Springs, Pembroke, Maxton, Rowland, Rex, Raemon, Hamer, South Of The Border, Shannon, Buie, Wakulla, Purvis, Prospect, Little Rock, Minturn, Elrod, Parkton, Rennert and Lumber Bridge. This includes the following highways... Interstate 95 in South Carolina between mile markers 193 and 198. Interstate 95 in North Carolina between mile markers 1 and 7. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
